metadata.title: CVE-2016-1000110 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
The CGIHandler class in Python before 2.7.12 does not protect against the HTTP_PROXY variable name clash in a CGI script, which could allow a remote attacker to redirect HTTP requests.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1000110` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-3build1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-3build1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-3build1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-3build1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-3build1
python2.7 - 2.7.12-3build1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-3build1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-3build1
No subscription required

notes.note: sbeattie> may also need patches from https://bugs.python.org/issue26804

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-3build1').
